commit.message: New pull tester which adds a rather simple large-reorg test

files.patch:
@@ -163,7 +163,7 @@ test_bitcoin_filtered.info: test_bitcoin.info
 
 block_test.info: test_bitcoin_filtered.info
 	$(MKDIR_P) qa/tmp
-	-@TIMEOUT=15 qa/pull-tester/run-bitcoind-for-test.sh $(JAVA) -jar $(JAVA_COMPARISON_TOOL) qa/tmp/compTool 0
+	-@TIMEOUT=30 qa/pull-tester/run-bitcoind-for-test.sh $(JAVA) -jar $(JAVA_COMPARISON_TOOL) qa/tmp/compTool 0 1
 	$(LCOV) -c -d $(abs_builddir)/src --t BitcoinJBlockTest -o $@
 	$(LCOV) -z -d $(abs_builddir)/src
 	$(LCOV) -z -d $(abs_builddir)/src/leveldb
@@ -192,7 +192,7 @@ endif
 if USE_COMPARISON_TOOL
 check-local:
 	$(MKDIR_P) qa/tmp
-	@qa/pull-tester/run-bitcoind-for-test.sh $(JAVA) -jar $(JAVA_COMPARISON_TOOL) qa/tmp/compTool $(COMPARISON_TOOL_REORG_TESTS) 2>&1
+	@qa/pull-tester/run-bitcoind-for-test.sh $(JAVA) -jar $(JAVA_COMPARISON_TOOL) qa/tmp/compTool $(COMPARISON_TOOL_REORG_TESTS) 1 2>&1
 endif
 
 EXTRA_DIST = $(top_srcdir)/share/genbuild.sh qa/pull-tester/rpc-tests.sh qa/pull-tester/run-bitcoin-cli qa/rpc-tests $(DIST_DOCS) $(WINDOWS_PACKAGING) $(OSX_PACKAGING)

commit.message:
Various fixes to make travis work with the larger blocktester

Travis needed a number of things, including disabling the new
tests if we're running with DEBUG_LOCKORDER (to prevent timeout),
logging output to a file instead of stderr to avoid running travis
over its max-log limit, disabling the new tests entirely on
Windows (wine), and reducing dbcache for the new tests (to avoid
Travis OOMing us).

files.patch:
@@ -27,17 +27,17 @@ matrix:
     - compiler: ": ARM"
       env: HOST=arm-linux-gnueabihf PACKAGES="g++-arm-linux-gnueabihf" DEP_OPTS="NO_QT=1" GOAL="install" BITCOIN_CONFIG="--enable-glibc-back-compat"
     - compiler: ": bitcoind"
-      env: HOST=x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu PACKAGES="bc" DEP_OPTS="NO_QT=1 NO_UPNP=1 DEBUG=1" RUN_TESTS=true GOAL="install" BITCOIN_CONFIG="--enable-glibc-back-compat CPPFLAGS=-DDEBUG_LOCKORDER"
+      env: HOST=x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu PACKAGES="bc" DEP_OPTS="NO_QT=1 NO_UPNP=1 DEBUG=1" RUN_TESTS=true GOAL="install" BITCOIN_CONFIG="--enable-glibc-back-compat CPPFLAGS=-DDEBUG_LOCKORDER --enable-comparison-tool-barely-expensive-tests=no"
     - compiler: ": No wallet"
       env: HOST=x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu DEP_OPTS="NO_WALLET=1" RUN_TESTS=true GOAL="install" BITCOIN_CONFIG="--enable-glibc-back-compat"
     - compiler: ": 32-bit + dash"
       env: HOST=i686-pc-linux-gnu PACKAGES="g++-multilib bc" RUN_TESTS=true GOAL="install" BITCOIN_CONFIG="--enable-glibc-back-compat" USE_SHELL="/bin/dash"
     - compiler: ": Cross-Mac"
       env: HOST=x86_64-apple-darwin11 PACKAGES="cmake libcap-dev libz-dev libbz2-dev" OSX_SDK=10.9 GOAL="deploy"
     - compiler: ": Win64"
-      env: HOST=x86_64-w64-mingw32 PACKAGES="nsis gcc-mingw-w64-x86-64 g++-mingw-w64-x86-64 binutils-mingw-w64-x86-64 mingw-w64-dev wine bc" RUN_TESTS=true GOAL="deploy" BITCOIN_CONFIG="--enable-gui" MAKEJOBS="-j2"
+      env: HOST=x86_64-w64-mingw32 PACKAGES="nsis gcc-mingw-w64-x86-64 g++-mingw-w64-x86-64 binutils-mingw-w64-x86-64 mingw-w64-dev wine bc" RUN_TESTS=true GOAL="deploy" BITCOIN_CONFIG="--enable-gui --enable-comparison-tool-barely-expensive-tests=no" MAKEJOBS="-j2"
     - compiler: ": Win32"
-      env: HOST=i686-w64-mingw32 PACKAGES="nsis gcc-mingw-w64-i686 g++-mingw-w64-i686 binutils-mingw-w64-i686 mingw-w64-dev wine bc" RUN_TESTS=true GOAL="deploy" BITCOIN_CONFIG="--enable-gui" MAKEJOBS="-j2"
+      env: HOST=i686-w64-mingw32 PACKAGES="nsis gcc-mingw-w64-i686 g++-mingw-w64-i686 binutils-mingw-w64-i686 mingw-w64-dev wine bc" RUN_TESTS=true GOAL="deploy" BITCOIN_CONFIG="--enable-gui --enable-comparison-tool-barely-expensive-tests=no" MAKEJOBS="-j2"
 install:
     - if [ -n "$PACKAGES" ]; then travis_retry sudo apt-get update; fi
     - if [ -n "$PACKAGES" ]; then travis_retry sudo apt-get install --no-install-recommends --no-upgrade -qq $PACKAGES; fi

@@ -163,7 +163,7 @@ test_bitcoin_filtered.info: test_bitcoin.info
 
 block_test.info: test_bitcoin_filtered.info
 	$(MKDIR_P) qa/tmp
-	-@TIMEOUT=30 qa/pull-tester/run-bitcoind-for-test.sh $(JAVA) -jar $(JAVA_COMPARISON_TOOL) qa/tmp/compTool 0 1
+	-@TIMEOUT=30 qa/pull-tester/run-bitcoind-for-test.sh 1 $(JAVA) -jar $(JAVA_COMPARISON_TOOL) qa/tmp/compTool 0 1
 	$(LCOV) -c -d $(abs_builddir)/src --t BitcoinJBlockTest -o $@
 	$(LCOV) -z -d $(abs_builddir)/src
 	$(LCOV) -z -d $(abs_builddir)/src/leveldb
@@ -192,7 +192,7 @@ endif
 if USE_COMPARISON_TOOL
 check-local:
 	$(MKDIR_P) qa/tmp
-	@qa/pull-tester/run-bitcoind-for-test.sh $(JAVA) -jar $(JAVA_COMPARISON_TOOL) qa/tmp/compTool $(COMPARISON_TOOL_REORG_TESTS) 1 2>&1
+	@qa/pull-tester/run-bitcoind-for-test.sh $(COMPARISON_TOOL_EXPENSIVE_TESTS) $(JAVA) -jar $(JAVA_COMPARISON_TOOL) qa/tmp/compTool $(COMPARISON_TOOL_REORG_TESTS) $(COMPARISON_TOOL_EXPENSIVE_TESTS) 2>&1
 endif
 
 EXTRA_DIST = $(top_srcdir)/share/genbuild.sh qa/pull-tester/rpc-tests.sh qa/pull-tester/run-bitcoin-cli qa/rpc-tests $(DIST_DOCS) $(WINDOWS_PACKAGING) $(OSX_PACKAGING)

@@ -101,6 +101,11 @@ AC_ARG_ENABLE([comparison-tool-reorg-tests],
     [use_comparison_tool_reorg_tests=$enableval],
     [use_comparison_tool_reorg_tests=no])
 
+AC_ARG_ENABLE([comparison-tool-barely-expensive-tests],
+    AS_HELP_STRING([--enable-comparison-tool-barely-expensive-tests],[enable barely expensive reorg tests in the comparison tool (default yes)]),
+    [use_comparison_tool_expensive_tests=$enableval],
+    [use_comparison_tool_expensive_tests=yes])
+
 AC_ARG_WITH([qrencode],
   [AS_HELP_STRING([--with-qrencode],
   [enable QR code support (default is yes if qt is enabled and libqrencode is found)])],
@@ -329,6 +334,15 @@ else
   AC_SUBST(COMPARISON_TOOL_REORG_TESTS, 0)
 fi
 
+if test x$use_comparison_tool_expensive_tests != xno; then
+  if test x$use_comparison_tool = x; then
+    AC_MSG_ERROR("comparison tool barekly expensive tests but comparison tool was not specified")
+  fi
+  AC_SUBST(COMPARISON_TOOL_EXPENSIVE_TESTS, 1)
+else
+  AC_SUBST(COMPARISON_TOOL_EXPENSIVE_TESTS, 0)
+fi
+
 if test x$use_lcov = xyes; then
   if test x$LCOV = x; then
     AC_MSG_ERROR("lcov testing requested but lcov not found")

@@ -9,19 +9,25 @@ mkdir -p "$DATADIR"/regtest
 touch "$DATADIR/regtest/debug.log"
 tail -q -n 1 -F "$DATADIR/regtest/debug.log" | grep -m 1 -q "Done loading" &
 WAITER=$!
+DB_CACHE_SET=""
+if [ "x$1" = "x1" ]; then DB_CACHE_SET="-dbcache=50"; fi
 PORT=`expr 10000 + $$ % 55536`
-"@abs_top_builddir@/src/bitcoind@EXEEXT@" -connect=0.0.0.0 -datadir="$DATADIR" -rpcuser=user -rpcpassword=pass -listen -keypool=3 -debug -debug=net -logtimestamps -checkmempool=0 -relaypriority=0 -port=$PORT -whitelist=127.0.0.1 -regtest -rpcport=`expr $PORT + 1` &
+"@abs_top_builddir@/src/bitcoind@EXEEXT@" -connect=0.0.0.0 -datadir="$DATADIR" -rpcuser=user -rpcpassword=pass -listen -keypool=3 -debug -debug=net -logtimestamps -checkmempool=$1 -relaypriority=0 -port=$PORT -whitelist=127.0.0.1 -regtest -rpcport=`expr $PORT + 1` $DB_CACHE_SET &
 BITCOIND=$!
+shift
 
 #Install a watchdog.
 (sleep 10 && kill -0 $WAITER 2>/dev/null && kill -9 $BITCOIND $$)&
 wait $WAITER
 
+#Write something to stdout every 5 minutes so travis doesnt get upset
+(while [ true ]; do sleep 300; echo "5-minute MARK"; done)&
+
 if [ -n "$TIMEOUT" ]; then
-  timeout "$TIMEOUT"s "$@" $PORT
+  timeout "$TIMEOUT"s "$@" $PORT > "$DATADIR/tester.log" 2>&1
   RETURN=$?
 else
-  "$@" $PORT
+  "$@" $PORT > "$DATADIR/tester.log" 2>&1
   RETURN=$?
 fi
 
@@ -31,6 +37,6 @@ kill $BITCOIND && wait $BITCOIND
 # timeout returns 124 on timeout, otherwise the return value of the child
 
 # If $RETURN is not 0, the test failed. Dump the tail of the debug log.
-if [ $RETURN -ne 0 ]; then tail -n 200 $DATADIR/regtest/debug.log; fi
+if [ $RETURN -ne 0 ]; then echo "block-tester returned $RETURN"; tail -n 200 "$DATADIR/regtest/debug.log"; tail -n 500 "$DATADIR/tester.log"; fi
 
 exit $RETURN

commit.message: TRAVIS: Run dmesg on signal 137 (prints basic OOM kill info)

files.patch:
@@ -38,5 +38,6 @@ kill $BITCOIND && wait $BITCOIND
 
 # If $RETURN is not 0, the test failed. Dump the tail of the debug log.
 if [ $RETURN -ne 0 ]; then echo "block-tester returned $RETURN"; tail -n 200 "$DATADIR/regtest/debug.log"; tail -n 500 "$DATADIR/tester.log"; fi
+if [ $RETURN = 137 ]; then dmesg | tail; fi
 
 exit $RETURN
